job_description:
Our client, a designer/manufacturer and global integrator of welding and assembly systems and material handling systems, is in search of a Controls Application Engineer to join their Automation and Assembly group.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Design new equipment from the ground level and problem-solve complex controls-related problems that require deeper investigation
Test and validate new pieces of hardware as well as develop and try out new software code
Lead hardware and software design R&D projects
Interface between the mechanical design and controls design group, helping to ensure that project goals are achieved
Lead test engineer for EV battery systems, helping control the architecture and test routines
Prepare and perform the design of experiments, performance and validation testing for the Engineering Team, including customer requests, design improvements and field-related issues that require improvements
Engineering testing activities while working directly on live projects
Improve and develop control systems and sub-systems for automation and machine tools, including Advanced servo systems, PLC, Sensors, Robotic Integration, Industry 4.0, Vision Systems, software and hardware architecture
Develop new concepts, including prototype development, performance testing and final implementations
Assist in the processing phase to ensure that all customer requirements and specifications are met in the early stages of a program
Follow up through the manufacturing phases to ensure that all challenges are met to prove out the function of the intended designs
Troubleshooting at customer facilities when issues arise that need engineering assistance to resolve
Prepare technical calculations, 3D CAD, FEA, and similar as required to support active projects
Provide technical support on projects throughout the project lifecycle
Review applications as a complete system, including mechanical, controls, manufacturing, operation and maintenance
Develop application standards, best practices, and technical documentation for projects
REQUIRED SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS:
A completed university program in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics or equivalent with a strong focus on machine design, prototype development and testing
3 - 8 years of experience in machine design, development and performance testing of custom products, tools, machines and assembly systems
Ability to read and interpret industrial electrical drawings
Working knowledge of industrial controls hardware and software
Experience with FEA (Finite Element Analysis), Strength of Materials, Statics and Dynamics
Knowledge of Leak Test machine design and instrumentation, Pressure Decay, Differential Pressure and Mass Airflow
Understanding of Kinematics, Motion and Motion profiles, Motor / Servo Sizing, Gearbox selection and sizing, Servo Presses, Control Theory and Motion of moving bodies
Hands-on experience in machining, welding and assembly, fabrication, testing and experimentation
Familiarity with Automation, PLCs, Robotics, Sensing and control technologies, Vision Systems
Background in Project Engineering or Project Management is highly desirable
A proven ability to work well within a team-based work environment, prioritizing plans of action to accomplish objectives
Excellent team, communication, time management and organizational skills
NOTE:
Travel to USA and Mexico is highly probable. Must be willing and able to travel internationally, without restrictions, effective on the start date
OTHER PERKS & BENEFITS:
Competitive health, dental, vision, employee assistance and wellness benefits, beginning on the first day of employment
Matching Contribution pension plan
Internal development and promotion opportunities, both locally and globally
Tuition Reimbursement
Employee referral bonus program
Social events and community engagement
Customer and other marketplace discounts
